docs.abstract: The judges, who are part of the Justice Department, spoke of concerns that the attorney general’s hard-line immigration policies are interfering with due process.
docs.snippet: The judges, who are part of the Justice Department, spoke of concerns that the attorney general’s hard-line immigration policies are interfering with due process.
docs.lead_paragraph: TYSONS, Va. — As the nation’s immigration judges gathered here for training this week, Attorney General Jeff Sessions had a message: They needed to help “end the lawlessness that now exists in our immigration system.”

headline.main: Immigration Judges Express Fear That Sessions’s Policies Will Impede Their Work
headline.print_headline: Immigration Judges Balk at Boss’s Plans

docs.abstract: Presidential power has long been viewed as an antidote for the Justice Department’s backlog of clemency applications. But President Trump could be making the system less just, advocates warn.
docs.snippet: Presidential power has long been viewed as an antidote for the Justice Department’s backlog of clemency applications. But President Trump could be making the system less just, advocates warn.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For those who view the Justice Department’s pardon system as slow and sclerotic, with its backlog of more than 11,000 cases, they need only look to the case of Matthew Charles.

headline.main: Pardon System Needs Fixing, Advocates Say, but They Cringe at Trump’s Approach
headline.print_headline: They Wanted to Update the Pardon System, but Not Like This

docs.abstract: The department’s inspector general announced that he would examine whether law enforcement officials followed the law in seeking permission to surveil a former Trump campaign adviser.
docs.snippet: The department’s inspector general announced that he would examine whether law enforcement officials followed the law in seeking permission to surveil a former Trump campaign adviser.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Justice Department’s inspector general, facing increasing political pressure from Republicans in Congress and Attorney General Jeff Sessions, said on Wednesday that his office would investigate the surveillance of a former Trump campaign official.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Will Be Investigated Over Surveillance of Trump Campaign Official
headline.print_headline: Inspector General Says He Will Investigate Surveillance of Trump Campaign Aide

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Nicholas Fandos and Katie Benner

docs.abstract: The moves come amid rising public pressure on the Trump administration to find ways to curb gun violence after a mass shooting in Parkland, Fla.
docs.snippet: The moves come amid rising public pressure on the Trump administration to find ways to curb gun violence after a mass shooting in Parkland, Fla.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Attorney General Jeff Sessions said on Friday that the Justice Department was proposing to ban so-called bump stocks through regulations rather than wait for Congress to act, a move that defies recommendations by federal law enforcement officials and could subject the department to litigation from gun rights groups.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Proposes Banning Bump Stocks, Setting Aside Its Own Recommendations
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Proposes Rule to Ban Bump Stocks

docs.abstract: President Trump tweeted that he and President Xi Jinping of China will “always be friends, no matter what happens with our dispute on trade.”
docs.snippet: President Trump tweeted that he and President Xi Jinping of China will “always be friends, no matter what happens with our dispute on trade.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Amid fears of an escalating trade war between the United States and China, President Trump tweeted Sunday morning that he and President Xi Jinping of China will “always be friends, no matter what happens with our dispute on trade.”

headline.main: Amid Fears of Trade War, Trump Predicts China Will Relent

docs.abstract: If the president stands firm, his former strategist said, he will fulfill the promise of his campaign. If he retreats, he will demonstrate that the Trump movement wasn’t much of a movement after all.
docs.snippet: If the president stands firm, his former strategist said, he will fulfill the promise of his campaign. If he retreats, he will demonstrate that the Trump movement wasn’t much of a movement after all.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — To Stephen K. Bannon, the political strategist who helped get President Trump elected but no longer speaks to him, the next few weeks will present his former client with the ultimate litmus test.

headline.main: To Bannon, Tariffs on China Will Be Ultimate Test of Trump’s Beliefs
headline.print_headline: For Bannon, Tariffs Are Test of Trump’s Beliefs

docs.abstract: The president alluded to the mission on Tuesday when he said that the United States was in direct talks with North Korea at “extremely high levels.”
docs.snippet: The president alluded to the mission on Tuesday when he said that the United States was in direct talks with North Korea at “extremely high levels.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. — President Trump dispatched the C.I.A. director Mike Pompeo to North Korea to meet with its leader, Kim Jong-un, in recent weeks to lay the groundwork for a summit meeting between Mr. Kim and Mr. Trump, two people briefed on the secret trip said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Mike Pompeo, C.I.A. Director, Met With Kim Jong-un in North Korea
headline.print_headline: Director of C.I.A.  Met With Leader  Of North Korea

byline.original: By Mark Landler and Matthew Rosenberg

docs.abstract: Administration officials say that Ivanka Trump could smooth some of the tensions that flared during the vice president’s visit, even if they insist that is not the purpose of her trip.
docs.snippet: Administration officials say that Ivanka Trump could smooth some of the tensions that flared during the vice president’s visit, even if they insist that is not the purpose of her trip.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When the sister of Kim Jong-un made her historic visit to the Winter Olympics in South Korea two weeks ago, saying nothing but commanding noisy press coverage, the South Korean news media quickly called her “North Korea’s Ivanka.”

headline.main: An Envoy Who Can Rival ‘North Korea’s Ivanka’
headline.print_headline: An Envoy Who Can Rival ‘North Korea’s Ivanka’

docs.abstract: The president celebrates the ground breaking of a high tech campus of a Taiwanese firm while telling Harley Davidson: “Don’t get cute with us.”
docs.snippet: The president celebrates the ground breaking of a high tech campus of a Taiwanese firm while telling Harley Davidson: “Don’t get cute with us.”
docs.lead_paragraph: MOUNT PLEASANT, Wis. — Standing inside a cavernous warehouse, President Trump cheered the groundbreaking for a Taiwanese electronic screen-making factory on Thursday as a shining example of his economic agenda’s success.

headline.main: In Wisconsin Visit, Trump Cheers One Company and Criticizes Another

docs.abstract: The president’s hint of flexibility came after North Korea declared last week that it would never agree to unilaterally surrender its weapons and threatened to cancel a June summit meeting.
docs.snippet: The president’s hint of flexibility came after North Korea declared last week that it would never agree to unilaterally surrender its weapons and threatened to cancel a June summit meeting.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump opened the door on Tuesday to a phased dismantling of North Korea’s nuclear weapons program, backing away from his demand that the North’s leader, Kim Jong-un, completely abandon his arsenal without any reciprocal American concessions.

headline.main: Trump Backs Away From Demand for Immediate North Korean Denuclearization
headline.print_headline: Trump Backs Off  Demand That Kim  Disarm Instantly

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: ARMS CONTROL AND LIMITATION AND DISARMAMENT
